understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that creates different types of GI engines based on the 'gi.engine' configuration option.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration as it reads the 'gi.engine' configuration option to determine which type of GI engine to create.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code reads the 'depths.reflection' value from the options provided. It then sets the 'maxReflectionDepth' variable to this value. It also performs some validation on the depth values and initializes certain components based on the configuration options.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered when the 'build' method is called with the 'Options' parameter. This method is likely called during the initialization or setup phase of the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The 'depths.reflection' configuration option impacts the maximum depth for reflection rays in the rendering process. Setting this value higher may result in more accurate reflections but could also increase rendering time and memory usage.
